p:
Here
λ h
( t )
and
λ v
( t )
are the time-varying rates of mosquito-to-human infection and mosquito birth, respectively, and other parameters are the respective class transition rates. Their numerical results show that there is considerable temporal variation in mosquito incidence and biting rate that the basic SIR model does not capture, and showed through retro-fitting on past data that a seasonal model accounting for variable biting rate can accurately predict future disease incidences.
